conversation.message: Company_A is my absolute top preference. I am confident that my qualifications are an excellent match for your team. I formally submit my application for the open position.
conversation.thought:
As Seeker_B, my goal is to secure my highest possible preference. My top choice is Company_A. Company_A ranks me (Seeker_B) as their second preference, right after Seeker_A. In Round 1, the optimal strategy is to apply to my top preference immediately.
I anticipate that Seeker_A, whose top choice is Company_B, might apply there, leaving Company_A open for me. Even if Seeker_A applies to Company_A, I must still signal my commitment to my top preference first, as the matching mechanism is uncertain (immediate acceptance vs. deferred acceptance logic). I will use the [APPLY] tag.

Waiting for Seeker_A is risky, as they might match with Company_B. Therefore, I will accept Seeker_B immediately.

Therefore, applying immediately to my Rank 1 choice, Company_D, is the best strategy, as the competition for this specific company is likely diverted elsewhere in Round 1.

Securing a match, even with my lowest priority candidate, is prudent given the market dynamics where I am not a preferred employer for my high-priority targets. I will accept Seeker_E to fulfill my quota.
